support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with proteasome-associated deubiquitinating enzymes, including USP14, as part of its role in protein quality control.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with USP14, a deubiquitinase that associates with the 19S regulatory particle of the proteasome and is involved in editing ubiquitin chains on substrates prior to their degradation.
functions.effect_description: The interaction between ATXN3 and USP14 suggests a coordinated role in processing ubiquitinated proteins at the proteasome, influencing substrate fate.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds USP14 at the proteasome -> Coordinated regulation of ubiquitin chain trimming -> Modulation of substrate degradation

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with USP14, a deubiquitinase that associates with the 19S regulatory particle of the proteasome and is involved in editing ubiquitin chains on substrates prior to their degradation.
effect: The interaction between ATXN3 and USP14 suggests a coordinated role in processing ubiquitinated proteins at the proteasome, influencing substrate fate.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with USP14 to modulate proteasomal degradation.
